name: ifptru
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: bitr2d(w0, wif(w0, w1, w2), w1, wi(w0, w1))
stmt.pretty: bitr2d(w0, if(w0, w1, w2), w1, (w0 → w1))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wi(w0, wb(w1, wi(w0, w1)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wif(w0, w1, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wi(w0, wb(w1, wi(w0, w1)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wif(w0, w1, w2)))

|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wif(w0, w1, w2)))

stmt.origin: syl6bbr(w0, wi(w0, w1), wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wif(w0, w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2))))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2))))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wi(w0, w1), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2))))
-| wi(w0, wo(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wo(w0, w2))

|- wi(w0, wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w1))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wo(w0, w2)))

comment: Value of the conditional operator for propositions when its first argument is true. Analogue for propositions of ~ iftrue . This is essentially ~ dedlema . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Sep-2019.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 10-Jul-2020.)
